e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it promotes honest financial reporting and aligns with ethical standards. An unbiased report of earnings enhances trust and credibility with investors, reflects the company’s true performance, and mitigates potential legal risks. Although some investors may initially misunderstand the changes, the long-term benefit of transparency outweighs the short-term challenges.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, clarity, and accuracy in financial disclosures. It should reflect true performance without manipulation or bias that could mislead investors. Additionally, ethical considerations include the impact on all stakeholders, including retail investors, and ensuring consistent communication about reporting policies. Putting the long-term trust and integrity of the company above short-term gains is essential in maintaining a responsible corporate reputation.
e6: Yes, I would ask the management team how they plan to communicate the policy change to investors to ensure understanding and mitigate confusion. Additionally, I would inquire about the strategies they will implement to monitor investor perceptions and reactions post-transition. It’s also important to understand how they intend to address any potential short-term impacts on stock performance following the policy change.
